itemDescription: United States Army Medal of Honor recipient

wikipedia_page.main: Moses Orr (1847—May 10, 1897) was an Irish-born soldier in the U.S. Army who served with the 1st U.S. Cavalry during the Apache Wars. He was one of several men who received the Medal of Honor for gallantry during Lieutenant Colonel George Crook's "winter campaign" against the Apache Indians in the Arizona Territory during 1872 and 1873.

response: * Moses Orr (1840–1897), Medal of Honor recipientMoses Orr, FOMMCI
